title: About Us
intro: Satu Cuaca is a research-to-practice initiative that turns air quality and weather data into concise, trustworthy insights for everyday decisions.
We prioritize scientific rigor, transparent methods, and a clear user experience without sacrificing analytical depth.

sections.title: Mission
items: Provide clear, relevant, and timely environmental information for everyone.
Help people plan safer outdoor activities through responsible recommendations.
Connect research outcomes with practical needs on the ground.

sections.title: Approach
items: Integrate calibrated sensor networks, weather observations, and short-term forecast models.
Apply automated quality control such as outlier filtering, de-spiking, data completeness checks, and humidity adjustments for particulate sensors.
Bring local context through field testing in Bandung and Johor so the guidance reflects local patterns.
Keep methods transparent with plain-language summaries.

sections.title: What You Get
items: Practical indices and guidance such as safe duration, mask needs, best time, route, and travel mode.
Concise air quality cards and maps plus key weather signals like rain, wind, and temperature.
Simple trends for favorite places and short articles in the News section.

sections.title: Our Values
items: Privacy by design. Location permission is optional and can be revoked at any time. Usage data is not sold.
Reliability and prudence. Alerts are issued only when needed and include confidence levels and brief rationale.
Accessibility. A simple and inclusive interface across ages and backgrounds.

sections.title: Collaboration
items: Open to partnerships with schools, communities, researchers, and local governments.
Support can include validation data, policy feedback, or environmental literacy programs.
Visit satucuaca.id to get in touch.

sections.title: Data Sources and Attribution
items: Meersens (meersens.com): US AQI with a 0 to 500 scale, category and color, dominant pollutant, and pollutant metrics.
Tomorrow.io (tomorrow.io): V2 weather condition codes and icons, plus some short-term signals for the weather card.
Open-Meteo (open-meteo.com): hourly and daily forecasts, including fallback for current conditions.
Note: third-party data is provided as is. Availability and accuracy may vary.
